title: SMART Irrigation - SMART WASH to respond to pandemics

tasks.task: Identify geographical hotspots of COVID-19 impacts on agriculture and health.
subtasks: Gather information on food insecurity risk indicators related to irrigated agriculture.
Evaluate health impact probability through the provision of safe water.
Overlay vulnerability maps for agriculture and health to determine overlapping hotspots.

tasks.task: Develop investment packages for interventions at on-farm and system levels.
subtasks: Select water conservation technologies meeting multiple-use criteria for food security and public hygiene.

tasks.task: Understand the importance of smart irrigation and smart wash approaches.
subtasks: Recognize the role of irrigation in enhancing food security.
Understand the need for water conservation technologies in expanding irrigation.
Acknowledge the importance of safe water for sanitation in pandemic control.

tasks.task: Assess the implications of emergency interventions on protecting vulnerable populations.
subtasks: Identify strategies to protect the most vulnerable during pandemics and food insecurity.
Ensure resource allocation for basic human needs (food security and human health).
